latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2670; text as passed Senate: CR S2687-2688)

item.text:
Honors the legacy of Baroness Margaret Thatcher for her commitment to advancing freedom and democracy.

Extends condolences to the family of Baroness Margaret Thatcher and the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

Recognizes that Baroness Margaret Thatcher, working with President Ronald Reagan, helped bring a peaceful end to the Cold War.

Supports the close ties and the special relationship between the United States and the United Kingdom.

Expresses admiration for Baroness Margaret Thatcher and her legacy as a transformative leader in the United Kingdom and the world.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Honors the legacy of Baroness Margaret Thatcher for her commitment to advancing freedom and democracy.

Extends condolences to the family of Baroness Margaret Thatcher and the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

Recognizes that Baroness Margaret Thatcher, working with President Ronald Reagan, helped bring a peaceful end to the Cold War.

Supports the close ties and the special relationship between the United States and the United Kingdom.

Expresses admiration for Baroness Margaret Thatcher and her legacy as a transformative leader in the United Kingdom and the world.
item.name: Passed Senate without amendment

item.title: A resolution honoring the life, legacy, and example of British Prime Minister Baroness Margaret Thatcher.
A resolution honoring the life, legacy, and example of British Prime Minister Baroness Margaret Thatcher.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
